desc: Should I mix my coins for privacy? What does this accomplish, and what is the be

msgs.text: Should I mix my coins for privacy? What does this accomplish, and what is the best way to do it?
https://twitter.com/NEEDcreations/status/1529865047081721858?t=IF6_3pYmxLqBqXC1wBoDpA&s=19

If you mix, then KYC places know you bought bitcoin, but they don't know where it ended up so they can't effectively prove you have it anymore. Swapping through different networks like lightning and liquid break the chain analysis.
interesting. Give me a clear example of "swapping through different networks" ELI5
Like do you mean moving coins through multiple LN custodians....say I have coins on Strike, then I send them to Blue Wallet, then to Zeus, then to Wallet of Satoshi, etc

Yeah, you can move sats through the lightning network and swap back out using Coinos, boltz.exchange, Wallet of Satoshi. Also, technically Strike does not know if you are sending lightning sats to your lightning wallet or someone else's lightning wallet.

If you peg-in to liquid sats, and then peg-out of liquid to back on-chain, the on-chain block analysis does not link the original UTXO to the final UTXO.
what do you mean by "peg-in" and "peg-out"?
This is the easiest way to peg-in and peg-out of the bitcoin liquid network right now for LBTC: https://sideswap.io/faq/peg-in-out/
So how to best consolidate a few small amounts held in random places? For example, some BTC in Fold, Robinhood, WeBull that havenâ€™t been moved out.

You can withdraw sats earned through Fold to any of your personal wallets, regardless if their hot/cold, custodial/not. It'll be an on-chain transaction.

Withdrawing from Robinhood and Webull will probably be very similar steps.. Execute whatever button they have to SEND/WITHDRAW your BTC, submit all the KYC info, enable 2FA, wait for verification, SEND to your personal wallet address.
https://twitter.com/raw_avocado/status/1552090346921803776?s=20&t=tKdftmlR2p-4vmwokxCQYA

<@456226577798135808> I also have some links somewhere in <#875765140711166053> but I need to organize these channels better. On the to do list. I'll send you some sats if you add to this channel here though!

BTC Sessions has a great video on using Whirlpool CoinJoin on Sparrow wallet. 

https://youtu.be/6TcUY2yU41w 

If you have never used  Sparrow you should check out this intro first: https://youtu.be/qJ_SpQX_YKw
Ideally you are running a node to link to your wallet to maximize your privacy.. after all mixing is about breaking any connections between you and your coins!

As you will have seen in the videos, mixing is easy. You pay a small fee for the first mix and the rest are free! Be warned this can take days or weeks to mix after the first round.. itâ€™s just how it works! You should let your coins mix 5 times (minimum) then mix into long-term cold storage 

Protips: you can mix into 100k, 1M, 5M and 50M.(0.5BTC) denominations.. but Iâ€™ve been told to mix into 1M denominations as the standard for long term holding and eventually spending. Always keep your ðŸš«KYC separate from all other coins.

What is a coinjoin and what does it achieve?
Coinjoins create forward privacy. They don't erase the previous history of the coins.

https://bitcoinmagazine.com/technical/a-comprehensive-bitcoin-coinjoin-guide
